title: What will be Rivian's end-of-day market capitalization on its first day of public trading?
possible_answers: More than $70 billion but less than $90 billion
Rivian will not trade publicly before 1 January 2022
correct_answer: More than $70 billion but less than $90 billion
preds: I am adjusting numbers a little higher due to slight increase in IPO price.  https://www.msn.com/en-us/money/companies/rivian-prices-ipo-at-78-a-share-valuing-electric-vehicle-company-at-665-billion/ar-AAQw2Ge?ocid=BingNewsSearch
I just read @DNK89 's reply and adjusted the numbers from my last analysis upward based upon the new IPO price.

The amount of the IPO is $53B--down from $80B.  Yet, the average first day pop from 2010 to 2020 has been 18 percent according to the nasdaq article below.  Moreover, the pop is greater for popular IPOs, large IPOs and tech IPOs.  Also, the pop is larger if the market has increase by at least 2.5 percent in the last three weeks.  The S&P 500 and nasdaq 100 have beaten that.   The new IPO date seems to be November 10th.  The relationship to Amazon (20 percent owner) and Ford (5 percent) should produce a lot of interest as well.  It is sort of a seal of approval from blue chip companies that know high tech and have a long history of successful car manufacturing.  Also, the fewer the shares that are offered ("floated"), the higher the valuation at the end of the day.  17.6 percent of all Rivian stock is being floated in this IPO.  I really do not know if that is considered a small or large offering, even though it sounds small to me.  On the down side, one-third of IPO end up below their opening price.    Why did Rivian lower the IPO from $80B to $53B?  This seems to be key.    It could be the underwriters realized the market believed the IPO was greatly over-priced as stated in the Forbes article below.   I cannot think of any other "good" reason.   So, lets start with $53B * 1.18 = $62.54 billion.   Add in the positives and adjust the 18 percent upward as initial outside view.    All of the positive above suggests it could go up to 100 percent or $106 billion as a max.  It could also be cut way down. The Forbes article, which seems very well reasoned, suggested no more that $13B is the real value of Rivian.   At worst, I doubt the company would fall by more than 50 percent.  So the min is $26.5B. Putting this all together (which I am lousy at).   The 90 percent interval is probably $26.5B to $106B.  Halfway would be $66.2B.   Since I get $68B and $66.2B with what I suspect is a wide standard deviation, lets say 15B,  my best guess is high $83B and low $52B.  If I had more time for this question, I would go through all the IPO mentioned in the article posted by @DNK89, categorize the companies and then compute a mean and standard deviation.   I think this would reduce the undertainty even more. https://www.nasdaq.com/articles/trends-in-ipo-pops-2021-03-04

Revising upwards on a report of revised valuation of $65bn

They have dropped the valuation from $80bn to $53bn now suggests tepid demand from institutional investors. 
Maybe there is a base rate to look at how stocks, whose initial IPO valuations have been revised downwards prior to the IPO, perform. ( I know that the Robinhood IPO valuation was revised downwards and the stock opened below its IPO price)
A list of all stocks that have gone public during the year and what was the price movement on listing day

All the air's been let out of the bag.
https://www.forbes.com/sites/greatspeculations/2021/11/04/even-at-a-lowered-valuation-dont-buy-rivians-ipo/?sh=35a8271030d1
Based on the two articles and goal of Rivian to reach 80 Mil valuation.

Outside view: Tesla grew over 40% on day one of trading.  Assuming they IPO at $80B that would take them to about $112B.  Average first day returns in 2020 was 36% ($108.8B at $80B offering) (https://www.statista.com/statistics/914701/first-day-gains-after-ipo-usa/) I think Rivian will skew much more toward the later.
Inside View: I think there is a chance market turmoil delays the IPO.  If the IPO goes through before the end of the year I think there is moderate hype and the stock wont jump or fall too far.

The production R1T is getting excellent reviews and the the company will have the benefit of having the EV pickup market to itself sor some time. If the political (debt ceiling) and market situation make a CY2021 IPO opportune, then there is a strong chance that investors will pile in.

There are few signals about that IPO, it may be delayed.
If not :
Biggest IPOS were below $30b; usual multiples are about 3 to 4x book value, so we can estimate that current book value around $10b, maximum will be $50b; we may have a frenesy on the IPO, but usually the pop happens during the first minutes of IPO then generally calms in the hours after.

Have you seen the R1T? It's a beaut.
Absolute adventure-mobile, and hey ...you can actually buy the thing. First to market, big backing... no matter how this resolves, this is news to follow: https://rivian.com/r1t
I didn't look closely enough to see last option is "will not trade publicly".  I'm going with crowd on that and then uniform distribution on rest.

Had to redo my forecast since they have filed for an IPO.  This means likely they will come public in 2021.  Targeted value is 80B that's in line with my previous prediction.  Still believe there is a good chance they don't go public til next year if the markets get choppy.
My prior.  I follow Rivian on LinkedIn but still I will have uniform distribution as my prior as I'm completely uncertain.

Don't think they are going to come public....but if they do Lucid Motors is 40B.  Rivian is a much bigger opp then Lucid.  I'd guess around 80B.  Not saying I'd pay that.. but given the market they serve and the customer list that would be my best guess.

They are talking about a 8B listing in the near future, so anything above 50 would seem to be off the table.  That leaves no IPO for this year as the next option, maybe this is more of a baiting exercise to test the waters and see how things are in the new year, follow up prospects and such
